Headline: Quickly catch up on the day's news
Article_Body: Here's what you might have missed Friday on CNN: -- The US House of Representatives passed a historic $2 trillion coronavirus stimulus package, sending it to President Trump to sign. -- New coronavirus hot spots are emerging in the Chicago, Detroit and New Orleans areas as the US overtakes China and Italy in total number of cases.  -- The coronavirus pandemic continues to upend daily life, with school closures for the rest of the year in some states, and frustrated health care workers in need of necessary supplies. Get live updates here.  -- UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson tested positive for coronavirus. His health secretary and his chief medical adviser have also tested positive. -- Walmart is seeing a rise in sales for tops but not bottoms while everyone is working from home. -- A fire inside a New York City subway car killed a 36-year-old train operator and injured several others. The fire appears to have been set intentionally.  -- Following her husband's burial in Nigeria, a woman was forced by her in-laws to take part in a series of rituals that included shaving her head and stripping near his grave. -- "Lost" star Evangeline Lilly apologized for refusing to self-quarantine.  -- Kim Kardashian and Kourtney Kardashian got into an argument that turned into a physical fight on the Season 18 premiere of "Keeping Up WIth The Kardashians."
